column4: chaps. nvidia+dual head with proprietry driver+ubuntu_gnome. how do I maximize window across both monitors?
With Compiz?
yes
Rizr: In general options, you can set the outputs. By default, it will try to force maximizing to only one monitor
Rizr: so you can set it there, or maybe disable Compiz if you want to test it
what's the option in general options?
i think it is Display Settings > Outputs.
outputs got 640x480+0+0 which is probably position and size?
what should be the value? My full desktop resolution is 2560x1024

right if you uncheck detect outputs it will probably mazimize across both monitors. I just tried it and it worked for me. I did not have to enter the full resolution. Try both, though if one doesn't work
needs X restart?
Rizr: i didn't need one
unchecking detect outputs didn't work for me.
Rizr: Then try entering the 2560x1025 manually in the outputs section as well
i take that one back. works.
Hooray!
cheers :-) one more thing. ideally a separate combination to maximize window across monitors and default action to do it on one. What do you reckon about that?

to my knowledge compiz doesn't support that. You can set per-window sizing, but it's not quite the same thing. I tried to get that "maximize" and "REALLY maximize" working once and couldn't find a good solution
gonna try using outputs options. may be get somewhere. cheers for this :-)
